thread.title: GOP lawmaker: Speaker sets House elections for next week
thread.title_full: GOP lawmaker: Speaker sets House elections for next week

title: GOP lawmaker: Speaker sets House elections for next week
text:
Updated: 9:49 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 | Posted: 9:49 a.m. Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015 GOP lawmaker: Speaker sets House elections for next week Related View Larger FILE - In this June 9, 2015, file photo, House Ways and Means Committee Chairman Paul Ryan, R-Wis., is seen in his office on Capitol Hill in Washington. House Republicans are returning from a weeklong recess to try to untangle their leadership mess. All eyes are on Ryan as he weighs whether to agree to entreaties from party leaders to enter the race for speaker. But conservatives are increasingly lining up against him. (AP Photo/Molly Riley, File) The Associated Press WASHINGTON â€” 
A Republican lawmaker says House Speaker John Boehner has scheduled elections to choose a new leader for next week. 
Rep. John Mica of Florida told reporters Wednesday morning that House Republicans will select their candidate for Speaker next Wednesday and the full House will choose a new Speaker to replace Boehner on Thursday. 
Mica spoke as House Republicans met behind closed doors a day after Wisconsin Rep. Paul Ryan said he would seek the speakership if the Republicans could unify behind his candidacy. 
Republicans have been bitterly divided with hardline conservatives forcing Boehner to announce his resignation last month and scaring off his No. 2, Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, who withdrew from the Speaker race. Copyright The Associated Press
